moving

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.Item
      • moving.Weapon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MeleeWeapon, RangedWeapon

    public class Weapon
extends Item
    A general "shell" for a weapon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(java.lang.String name,
      java.lang.String description,
      int xOnMap,
      int yOnMap,
      boolean isOnMap,
      double attSpeed,
      int[] damage,
      java.awt.Image img,
      java.awt.Image shotImage)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the melee weapon.
        description - The description of the melee weapon.
        xOnMap - The x-location of the weapon on the map, if it is on the map.
        yOnMap - The y-location of the weapon on the map, if it is on the map.
        isOnMap - Whether the item is on the map or not.
        attSpeed - The weapon's attack speed increase.
        damage - The weapon's damage, represented by an int array of two values (lower bound - upper bound)
        img - The Weapon's icon.
        shotImage - The weapon's bullet image.

    • Method Detail

      • getShotsToAdd

        public Shot[] getShotsToAdd(int xAdd,
                   int yAdd,
                   double angle,
                   Game myGame)
        A method that returns all "shots" that this weapon fires. The game will call this method when it needs the weapon to fire shots. The array of shots that is returned will be then added to the list of "shots" in the Game class.
        Parameters:
        xAdd - The x-position to add the shots to.
        yAdd - The y-position to add the shots to.
        angle - The angle to fire the shot at.
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.
        Returns:
        An array that contains all shots that the Game needs to add.
